fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-38928].
  {panel}

On both the Burndown Chart report in the Agile boards and the "Agile Sprint Burndown Gadget" on the Dashboards, the "Remaining Values" line is showing misleading information. 

I've configured my boards to use the "Remaining Estimate and Time Spent" setting, which is described as: "Track time against issues using JIRA's Remaining Estimate and Time Spent fields. *The Burndown Chart will be based on these two values.*"

However, when I look at the "Remaining Values" line on the burndown charts, I'm not seeing the sum of the remaining estimates field as expected. I'm pretty sure I'm instead seeing the "original estimate" minus the "time spent" field. 

I've attached a picture showing the burndown for tasks assigned to one of my users and the difference this can make. On the left, the chart filters out any closed tasks (which have their remaining estimates at 0, since no work effort remains) and only sums the remaining estimates of open or in-progress tasks. On the right, the filter is simply assignee=KB, and it shows over 100 additional hours. 

_(By way of explanation, this user was assigned a few tasks that were overflow when others needed to adjust their sprint commitments due to scope creep. These may have had large original estimates but the remaining effort was much less, as you can see in the charts.)_

Without getting into discussions about how we use the remaining estimate field and whether or not to update it, the issue is that in the Agile board's configuration settings, I'm lead to believe that the red "Remaining Values" line represents the sum of the "remaining estimates" field, which it is not, and should be.
fields.summary: Sprint Burndown Gadgets showing misleading "remaining values"
Update Tomcat Native DLL in JIRA Installer
Increase # of recently viewed projects shown in Projects drop down menu on main header navigation
Cannot customize the Issue Collector message appearing after succesfull issue submit

fields.description:
This bug allows loss of data without warning. It's not just theoretical, I discovered it and was burnt by the behaviour.

*Steps to reproduce:*

1. Browse to an issue, and click within the description to edit it.
2. Type in the word "foo", so that it's not in the description.
3. While the description is still being edited, press ⌘+f to search for text.
4. Search for "foo".
5. Press escape to dismiss the search.

What should have happened, is that your edits to the description have been lost. The reason this happens is that Chrome dismiss the Find panel on ESC *keydown*, which returns focus to the description input, and then on ESC *keyup* it discards the description editing.

Probably the easy fix here is to just change the description edit to bind to *keydown* rather than *keyup*.

In case you're wondering _why_ you'd search while editing a description, in my case it was because I had a very large description of bullet points, and wanted to make sure the new item I was adding wasn't already covered in an earlier place.
fields.summary: Pressing ESC to dismiss a Find… in Chrome while editing an issue's description discards changes without warning.

fields.description:
Default workflows are not firing the proper events in the Jira Event Services.

Steps to reproduce:
1) Create a new project with Software Development or Simple Workflow (those were the ones I tested)
2) Go to Project -> Administration -> Edit Workflow and go for any transition to "Done" and you are going to see that it fires a GenericEvent instead of the proper event.

This was verified only in this 2 workflows. It would be good to verify all the others.
fields.summary: Default Workflows from Jira are not firing the correct events

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-38916].
  {panel}

The Date Time Picker defaults to current time.

As requestor could fill out unknowingly, then the assignee assumes it's intentional.

In many cases you might want to allow it to be set, but it's better to assume 00:00:00 if not manually touched.

UI should be changed to not display hh:mm:ss when 00:00:00. 

Like a 'Went Live Date' is probably the time you're in the ticket adjusting (some may not have access to see your source code pushing) but a 'Want Live Date' might be ok with just the day, and if you want more specific set the time.

CUSTOMFIELDTYPEKEY
com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:datetime.autotime
or
com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:datetime.noautotime

Personally I'd change the behavior of datetime, and rollout a upgrade step to convert all datetime to date.autotime in existing installation databases.

Maybe even a button for 'insert current time' in the pop-up picker.

If debating defaults is a lengthily affair a new datetime.noautotime is cool.
fields.summary: Date Time custom field type auto time behavior

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-38914].
  {panel}

Easy toggle of custom field Date Picker format (date vs date+time) from UI

Having to go change the database OR making a new custom field and migrating OR changing look and feel to hide/show if ok toggling them all seems silly.

customfield might have
com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:datepicker
com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:daterange

But customfieldvalue always has the time anyways:
YYYY-MM-DD 00:00:00
`DATEVALUE` datetime DEFAULT NULL,

You can adjust the database to:
com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:datetime
com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:datetimerange 

Where in the UI would you go to change? Custom fields > edit > just beneath Search Template. Maybe call it Field Type Template. 

Could be re-used later for other easy switches https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Changing+Custom+Field+Types

---

Speaking of which (probably need to make new tickets for it):

The Date Time Picker defaults to current time. (In some cases you might want to allow it to be set, but assume 00:00:00 if not manually set.

Like a 'Went Live Date' is probably the time you're in the ticket adjusting, but a 'Want Live Date' might be ok with just the day, and if you want more specific set the time.
com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:datetime.autotime 

Would be nice if the built-in Due Date system field would allow time (it's stored same way in jiraissue), but default to 00:00:00 and not shown in UI unless filled out as well.
fields.summary: Toggle of custom field Date Picker format (date vs date+time) from UI

fields.description: On JIRA CSV import with mapped Issue Keys, any existing issue that gets updated has all the comments duplicated. fields.description: Not sure if this should be a bug or improvement request. The *group* API returns a list of users including an Active flag, but it is always true since inactive users that are part of the group are NOT included. Given there is an *active* flag, one would assume both types would be provided. At least there should be a parameter to control whether they are listed or not.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-38888].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
If a user tries to load JIRA gadget directory, the operation take a long time (up to a minute) to complete. It also causes a CPU usage spike, and affects the overall JIRA instance performance.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In a JIRA instance with multiple users, create or configure a dashboard. 
# Click *Add gadget* to display the gadget directory.

h3. Expected Results
The gadget directory loads without issues and all gadgets are displayed.

h3. Actual Results
The operation takes a long time, and consumes excessive CPU resources. This puts pressure on the whole instance, affecting other users that may be attempting to load other JIRA screens. 
In some cases pages fail to load altogether with an error:
{quote}Page unavailable
The requested page failed to load. If the problem persists, please contact Atlassian Cloud Support.{quote}

h3.Workaround
There is no workaround for this issue, although a later attempt to load the gadget directory may succeed if some of the data has been cached.
fields.summary: Loading JIRA gadget directory will cause CPU usage to spike, take long to load and all users will get affected
Request chart of issue number vs aging

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If a user is a member of a considerable amount of groups the view issue page will load slower.

h3. Environment

* Tested with Chrome 35.0.1916.153.
* No proxy, load-balancer or front-end - directly connecting to Tomcat.
* Tested on a dual Intel® Xeon® Processor E5462 / 12 GB Ram.
* PostgreSQL DB on the same host.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a user with more than 6k groups.
# View an issue.

h3. Expected Results

The issue loads at a normal rate (~2s).

h3. Actual Results

The load time is almost twice as fast (~5s).

h3. Notes
fields.summary: View Issue is much slower if the user has a lot of groups

Creating a new Dashboard Category field would make this much easier.
- In the Create New Dashboard page
- In the Edit and Share Dashboard page
- As a column in the various Manage Dashboards sub-pages
-- Favorites
-- My
-- Popular
-- Search
- In some Administration Page for creating new Dashboard Categories
fields.summary: Add Category to Dashboard management

Create a project containing versions with a start date set

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-38854].
  {panel}

Say you're dealing with a multi-line text field like the built-in Description.

some text (line1)

(line2 empty)

more text (line3)


If you edit the Description Line:

In the text email breaks are respected in the top changed area.

However, in the text email summary area it's compressed.


Using noformat or similar markup makes no difference.

issuesummary.vm uses
$!{velocityhelper.quote($!issue.description)}

and could use a getString("description") there (or some new helper might already exist to respect line break) http://wiki.apache.org/velocity/VelocityWhitespaceGobbling

Or at least if the line breaks / whitespace got converted into > (greater than symbol).
Why convert? Because Jira built-in mail handler has two modes strip quotes or strip after marker. (Add converting would keep strip quotes working).
fields.summary: Allow Text Email Line Break / Whitespace in issuesummary.vm

fields.description:
*Steps to Reproduce:*
* Create 4 versions in a project (e.g. 1, 2, 3 and 4)
* Add version 1 AND version 4 to a version field (i.e. FixVersion)
* In the Issue navigator, filter issues using FixVersion >= 2 and FixVersion <= 3

*Expected Results*
JIRA should only retrieve issues that contain versions between 2 and 3
 
*Actual results*
JIRA returns issues that have any two versions as long as one is bigger than 2 and one is lower than 3.
fields.summary: Issue Navigator doesn't filter versions correctly

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-38847].
  {panel}

The Kammalou Agile Workflow V1.0 (found at https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/kammalou.com.agile) is incomplete, it's post functions don't:

# change the issue status
# update issue history
# fire events

As a result it's essentially a useless workflow. This should be removed from the workflow importer until it works properly.
fields.summary: Remove 'Kammalou Agile Workflow V1.0' from JIRA's workflow importer
Next and Cancel buttons too close to each when remote copying issues

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If an instance has an indexing directory that is _not_ the default, it's possible to prevent indexing from occurring.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Restore an instance from a previous version of JIRA that had a customised index directory.
# Go to the indexing page and attempt to index it.

h3. Expected Results

The instance can be reindexed successfully.

h3. Actual Results

Indexing is disabled and the instance cannot be reindexed through the browser.

The following appears in the logs:

{noformat}
2014-06-20 11:37:19,266 http-bio-8080-exec-23 WARN localadmin 697x62x1 16hinsb 127.0.0.1 /secure/admin/IndexAdmin.jspa [jira.issue.index.IndexConsistencyUtils] Index consistency check failed for index 'Issue': com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.SearchUnavailableException: java.lang.IllegalStateException: Indexing is disabled.
{noformat}

An error in the screenshot appears to the user also.

h3. Workaround

This can be worked around as per [After upgrading JIRA indexing is disabled|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/After+upgrading+JIRA+indexing+is+disabled].

h3. Notes

This can also be disabled if the indexing directory is invalid:

{noformat}
2014-06-20 10:39:23,781 localhost-startStop-1 ERROR      [atlassian.jira.upgrade.ConsistencyCheckImpl] Indexing is turned on, but index path [/localdisk/var/jira/jira-index] invalid - disabling indexing
{noformat}
fields.summary: Migrating an instance can result in indexing being disabled

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-38844].
  {panel}

The JIRA import wizard should include a page notifying a user of any custom field values, resolutions, statuses and etc that will be created or added to JIRA during an import.

Example, https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-18480.

JIRA export adds Unresolved to any issue that is not resolved.  If the issues are imported back into JIRA a new Unresolved resolution will be created.  Previous JIRA issues states that this issue is "Won't Fix", JRA-18480.

It would be helpful during the import process a page showed exactly what new custom field values, resolutions, statuses and any other added values that will be created during the import.  In addition a checkbox should placed next to the value to be added so the user can decide to check/uncheck the box if they want the value to be added to JIRA.
fields.summary: Include notice of any items that will be created during a JIRA project import
Configure Fields button allows users to hide Required Fields

fields.summary: Incoming mail Update POP / IMAP Mail Server

fields.description:
h4. +Steps to Replicate+
# Download JIRA 6.1 Linux installer
# Run it with *Root* user
# Finish the Installation.

h4. +Expected Behavior+
JIRA's folders would have the correct permissions for user 'jira' and all files would be created without any issues.

h4. +Actual Behavior+
Jira's folders that are owned by the "jira" user don't have the write permission.
Upon JIRA start, the following error appears in catalina.out:
{noformat}
SEVERE: Unable to create directory for deployment: /opt/atlassian/jira/conf/Catalina/localhost
{noformat}

And the directory above fails to be created.
\\
*Note*: If the installer is ran by another user, all JIRA folders will have their permissions attached to only the user who ran the command, therefore the issue does not reproduce.
\\

h3. +Workaround:+
In order to fix this, you can either set the permission of the folder to 777, granting permission to all users, change the owner to root or give the folders the correct permission according to the *jira* user.

Also, you can use the version 6.2 instead, since this was fixed by then.
fields.summary: JIRA 6.1 permission issues when installing as Root
JQL API search gives misleading errors when the user doesn't have Browse Projects permission

fields.description:

# Visit the User Picker ({{/secure/popups/UserPickerBrowser.jspa}}).
# Search for a part of an email address or username of a user that exists (make sure that the email address/username start with it).
# [BUG] Only emaill addresses / usernames that start with the entered text will be returned.

h3. Expected Behaviour

fields.summary: Searching for an email address or username in the user picker popup is only able to find results starting with the entered text

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

Preconditions:
Project A with "default text renderer" for issues' description field.
Project B with "wiki text renderer" for issues' description field.

Try to bulk move issues with non-empty description from project A to project B and tick off the "retain" description field during the bulk process.

After the move, the moved issues have empty description while this is probably not what we want.
fields.summary: Bulk move process does not retain the description field for different renderers even if "retain" field is checked

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

1. Start to bulk move some issues
2. On project / issue type picker try to switch to a different project. Don't choose issue type, just let the default value to be selected.
3. Submit form.

You will receive error message like you have not submitted the issue type parameter, but from user's perspective you does (see attachment).

Note that this error occurs just in case you have the same issue type for all project in your JIRA instance.

From technical background:
There is <select /> element hidden for this JS picker which is not properly initialized with appropriate options.

// browser: chrome
fields.summary: Project issue type picker does not work properly for specific case
When using delegated LDAP, further syncs should not overwrite existing information in JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-38832].
  {panel}

login failure via external directories does not provide reason why the login failed and this is causing really big problem in corporate environments.

We tested this and this doesn't work neither with LDAP or Crowd. We are using Crowd so probably this will have to be implemented in both JIRA and Crowd.

{noformat}
--- account with invalid password
ldap_bind: Invalid credentials (49)
	additional info: 80090308: LdapErr: DSID-0C0903A8, 
comment: AcceptSecurityContext error, data 52e, v1db1

--- account with password expired
ldap_bind: Invalid credentials (49)
	additional info: 80090308: LdapErr: DSID-0C0903A8, 
comment: AcceptSecurityContext error, data 532, v1db1

--- disabled account
(TBD)

--- locked account
(TBD)
{noformat}

Note: the LDAP server being used is Microsoft Active Directory. Return codes are valid for all versions and seem to be similar across all LDAP servers.



525	user not found
52e	invalid credentials
530	not permitted to logon at this time
531	not permitted to logon at this workstation
532	password expired
533	account disabled
701	account expired
773	user must reset password
775	user account locked
fields.summary: login failure via external directories does not provide reason

fields.description:
When using IE 9, the page for displaying Permission Violation is different compared to Chrome and Firefox

h3. Steps to reproduce:
# Create a project and assign a Single-user only (_user1_) for "Browse Project" permission.
# Create an issue with using *user1*.
# Try to access the created issue with a different user (_user2_) who does not have the permission to browse the Project.

h3. Expected result:
The 'Permission Violation' page is the same across browsers

h3. Actual result:
On *IE 9*, this page is shown:
!violationie.png!

On *IE 11, Chrome and Firefox*, this page is shown:
!violationchrome.png!
fields.summary: Different Permission Violation page displayed in Internet Explorer 9
Support for Oracle 12c database in JIRA

fields.description: {panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa} *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-38827]. {panel} When adding values for a multi-select field, there is a suggestion that you can use HTML tags to make the values bold or colored or whatever. I have done this to some of my multi-select fields, and this has broken filters that were looking for them. Previously I had values "regression" and "degradation", which I changed to "regression" and "degradation". Now any filters that are looking for degradation or regression are broken. Instead I have to change the filters to include the HTML tags. What's more, the Basic filter creator will no longer work with this field, instead you have to use JQL when doing filters. This rather makes the ability to add HTML tags useless, as it makes it very difficult for the average user to filter on these fields now. The suggested fix is to only parse the HTML tags when displaying the multi-select field, but to strip it out for filtering purposes.
fields.summary: Putting HTML tags into multi-select options interferes with filtering
Improve Database Indexes to the PROPERTYENTRY Table
JIRA Gadget that would show all past releases

fields.description:
Reproduction steps:
1. Setup generic LDAP user repository (RW), with jira-users, jira-developers, jira-administrators groups.
2. Create user for John Smith as js@x.com.
3. Add him to jira-administrators group.
4. Remove user js@x.com (John changed the company).
5. Create user for Jake Sunny as js@x.com.

Result: newly hired Jake Sunny is administrator, now.
fields.summary: Removing user from LDAP doesn't clear LDAP group membership

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-38816].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce:
# install JIRA 6.2.x
# create a project .Eg: project FE
# create multiple users. Eg: *userA*,*userB*
# granted only "userA" to the Edit Issue permission in the project "FE"
# create new issue in project FE and add table into the Description field. Eg:
{code}
|| Food || Description || Colour||
| JIRA|  JIRA is the tracker for teams planning and building great products. Thousands of teams choose JIRA to capture and organize issues, assign work, and follow team activity | Blue|
|Confluence  | Give your team one place to share, find, and collaborate on information they need to get work done. | Blue|
| Bamboo| Bamboo does more than just run builds and tests. It connects issues, commits, test results, and deploys so the whole picture is available to your entire product team – from project managers, to devs and testers, to sys admins.  |Blue |
{code}
# (BUG)access the issue as "userA" using Google Chrome and the Description field appear as in ViewIssue.png

Notes:
* accessing the same issue as "userB" will shows the content nicely
* "userA" does not experience the same problem if accessing JIRA using other browser like Firefox. 

This is so far tested with:
* JIRA 6.2.2, JIRA 6.2.7
* Chrome 35.0.x
fields.summary: Description table did not render table content nicely when viewed using Chrome

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-38815].
  {panel}

I'm using jira-cli-3.9.0.jar to export some information for issues in a csv format. I'm filtering the appropriate issues and at some point I started getting error like this:

Remote error: Could not find or access issue with key: XXXX. Details: org.xml.sax.SAXParseException; lineNumber: 1; columnNumber: 1; Premature end of file.
java.rmi.RemoteException: Could not find or access issue with key: NEE-3301. Details: org.xml.sax.SAXParseException; lineNumber: 1; columnNumber: 1; Premature end of file.

I did some investigation and it appeared that just one issue, which falls in the filter is breaking the entire operation. The reason is a character in the description - if I delete it all works fine. I'm not sure where it came from, but here it's copy pasted - '', so in order to reproduce the problem just try to use the jira-cli to retrieve this current issue.
fields.summary: Special character in description breaks Jira CLI

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-38814].
  {panel}

The Workflow Properties of {{jira.field.resolution.exclude}} is working properly to exclude a particular Resolution to be showing in the select list for Resolution field.

However, when clicking on the Help Menu for Resolution field, it will listed a resolution which has been excluded using the Workflow properties.

h4. Steps to reproduce
# In fresh install, add new Resolution name "Completed"
# Create DEMO project
# Edit classic workflow
# Add workflow properties of {{jira.field.resolution.exclude}} with value 10000 in 'Resolve Issue' transition at status 'Open'
# Open DEMO project and switch scheme to use Classic workflow scheme
# Open DEMO-1 and try Resolve Issue - "Completed" won't be showing but clicking on the Help Menu will list it

h4. Expected Behaviour
The expected behaviour would be, excluding the resolution using Workflow properties should exclude it from both select list and Help menu to have better consistency.
fields.summary: Workflow Properties jira.field.resolution.exclude to also Exclude Information in Help Menu
Use of code macro in comment block formats incorrectly after save

fields.description:
JIRA 6.2.6 uses the 3.0.0-m24 version of the Atlassian plugins webresource library, in which WebResourceManager is deprecated.

The suggested replacement is WebResourceAssembler, but that class cannot be injected as WebResourceManager can, nor does it have a method that replaces WebResourceManger.requireResource(String resourceID).

It is suggested that PageBuilderService can be used to get the current WebResourceAssembler, but assembler() is an instance method and PageBuilderService cannot be instantiated with new, nor can it be injected.

These issues may all have something to do with the fact that version 3 of the Atlassian plugins webresource library has not been released yet. The version number of 3.0.0-m24 suggests that this is a development build, as does the absence of any version beyond 2.9 from the Atlassian developer documentation web pages.

I suggest that either
a. A production version of JIRA should depend on a production version of the webresource library rather than an unreleased and as-yet incompletely documented development build, or
b. The required managers be made injectable and methods with equivalent functionality to the deprecated ones be added, and the javadocs updated to reflect this, or
c. WebResourceManager have the @deprecated tag removed until a reasonable replacement becomes available.

I favor (a) as this should require just altering the relevant POM to include the production version of the webresource library, and in that version WebResourceManager is not deprecated. Additional code and documentation changes would be required to make (b) work.

If (a) won't work because JIRA 6 depends on new functionality from webresource 3.0, then I would favor (c) as a stopgap instead.
fields.summary: WebResourceManager is deprecated, but its javadoc provides no reasonable replacement.

fields.description:
I'm trying to create a custom bulk edit plugin.

All the other JIRA bulk classes make calls to BulkOperation.perform() (AbstractBulkWatchOperationAction, BulkDelete, BulkTransitionIssueOperation) or BulkMoveOperation.perform() (BulkMove). BulkOperation and BulkMoveOperation are part of the SPI.

But BulkEdit calls BulkEditOperation.perform(). BulkEditOperation is part of the Jira core classes, not part of the SPI.

As a result, the only way to create a custom Bulk Edit operation (say to add or delete labels) is to extend BulkEditOperation, which results in brittle code that can break whenever the implementation of BulkEdit or BulkEditOperation changes (as it did between revisions of Jira 6).

For verification, look at the implementation of BulkEdit.doPerform().
fields.summary: Impossible to create an SPI-compliant Bulk Edit Operation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-38800].
  {panel}

Description:
Our plugin extends / overrides the CreateWorklog action and - in addition - exchanges the view (original view was: /secure/views/issue/logwork.jsp from actions.xml)
Extract from atlassian-plugin.xml:
{code:xml}
<webwork1 key="ictime-extended-worklog" class="java.lang.Object">
    <actions>
      <action name="de.iconcept.ictime.actions.timeentry.ExtendedCreateTimeEntry" alias="CreateWorklog">
        <view name="input">/templates/ictime-webwork-module/extendedCreateEntry.vm</view>
        <view name="error">/templates/ictime-webwork-module/extendedCreateEntry.vm</view>
        <view name="invalidlicense">/templates/ictime-webwork-module/invalidLicense.vm</view>
        <view name="invalidJiraVersion">/templates/ictime-webwork-module/invalidJiraVersion.vm</view>
        <view name="securitybreach">/secure/views/securitybreach.jsp</view>
      </action>
    </actions>
  </webwork1>
{code}

If you click on the "Log Work" action within an issue, it happens - on customer installations - that an IllegalArgumentException is thrown:

{code}
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: name
        at sun.misc.URLClassPath$Loader.findResource(URLClassPath.java:494)
        at sun.misc.URLClassPath.findResource(URLClassPath.java:176)
        at java.net.URLClassLoader$2.run(URLClassLoader.java:551)
        at java.net.URLClassLoader$2.run(URLClassLoader.java:549)
        at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)
        at java.net.URLClassLoader.findResource(URLClassLoader.java:548)
        at org.apache.catalina.loader.WebappClassLoader.findResource(WebappClassLoader.java:1267)
        at org.apache.catalina.loader.WebappClassLoader.getResource(WebappClassLoader.java:1408)
        at com.atlassian.core.util.ClassLoaderUtils.getResource(ClassLoaderUtils.java:113)
        at com.atlassian.velocity.DefaultVelocityManager.exceptionHandling(DefaultVelocityManager.java:137)
        at com.atlassian.velocity.DefaultVelocityManager.writeEncodedBodyImpl(DefaultVelocityManager.java:123)
        at com.atlassian.velocity.DefaultVelocityManager.writeEncodedBody(DefaultVelocityManager.java:97)
        at com.atlassian.jira.template.velocity.DefaultVelocityTemplatingEngine$DefaultRenderRequest.toWriterImpl(DefaultVelocityTemplatingEngine.java:146)
        at com.atlassian.jira.template.velocity.DefaultVelocityTemplatingEngine$DefaultRenderRequest.asHtml(DefaultVelocityTemplatingEngine.java:134)
        at com.atlassian.jira.web.dispatcher.JiraVelocityViewDispatcher.dispatch(JiraVelocityViewDispatcher.java:50)
        at com.atlassian.jira.web.dispatcher.JiraWebworkViewDispatcher.dispatchViaVelocityView(JiraWebworkViewDispatcher.java:110)
        at com.atlassian.jira.web.dispatcher.JiraWebworkViewDispatcher.dispatchView(JiraWebworkViewDispatcher.java:69)
        at com.atlassian.jira.web.dispatcher.JiraWebworkActionDispatcher.service(JiraWebworkActionDispatcher.java:204)
{code}

From atlassian-jira.log:
{code}
2014-06-10 12:03:05,806 http-bio-8443-exec-61 ERROR earagones 723x176214x1 9cj4er 127.0.0.1 /secure/CreateWorklog!default.jspa [velocity] ResourceManager : unable to find resource 'de.iconcept.ictime.jira-ictime:ictime-extended-worklog//secure/views/issue/logwork.jsp' in any resource loader.
{code}

This means, that the webwork plugin from jira tried to find the original logwork.jsp in our plugin code instead of using the original jsp provided by jira OR taking the overriden velocity view defined in the atlassian-plugin.xml.

Enabling / disabling the plugin does not solves the problem. We are not able to reproduce the problem, but it happens frequently on customer sites installing our plugin.
fields.summary: Webwork module resource lookup sometimes failing

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce the error

* Have a text file around 7.08 MB
* Create an issue
* Click "More" and then "Attach Files"
* Paste the text into comment field. 
* Add any attachment (optional)
* Hit attach button. 
* Error message appears; attachment and comment is not saved.
fields.summary: XSRF Security Token Missing when adding long text in an attachment
Add additional JQL functions for sub-task queries

fields.description:
When you have some filters applying to a Custom Field, and then you decide to rename this Custom Fields, all the filters will stop working complaining that the Custom Field does not exist.

h3. Expected Behaviour:

The filters should continue working after renaming the Custom Field
fields.summary: Renaming a Custom Field, filters will stop working.
List down inactive or no longer used filter
"Create and New" button

fields.description:
h3. Summary
SQL Server jTDS driver will not permit more than 2000 literals in an IN clause and this causes problem as OfBiz will attempt to query the SQL Server with IN clauses that have >2k literals and will throw exceptions.

h3. Environment
SQL Server 2008 SP3. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to JIRA with more than 2100 projects 
# Go into the "User Browser"
# For any user, click on the "Project Roles" link

This can also be reproduced anywhere within JIRA where OfBiz queries the database in this manner, for example:

* Accessing the Activity Stream.
* Viewing a large change history on an issue.


h3. Expected Results
JIRA functions without error.

h3. Actual Results
This will generate the following SQL (Oracle) error:
{noformat}
2014-06-16 06:06:29,718 StreamsCompletionService::thread-1 ERROR admin 366x32x5 oardx6 10.60.2.93 /plugins/servlet/streams [atlassian.streams.internal.LocalActivityProvider] Exception building feed
com.atlassian.jira.exception.DataAccessException: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDataSourceException: Ofbiz generates queries with large IN clauses that result in while executing the following:SELECT sq_.ID FROM (SELECT ID, ROW_NUMBER() OVER (ORDER BY UPDATED DESC) rnum FROM dbo.jiraissue WHERE PROJECT IN (?, ?... ?) ) sq_ WHERE sq_.rnum <= 5 (Prepared or callable statement has more than 2000 parameter markers.)
	at com.atlassian.jira.ofbiz.DefaultOfBizDelegator.findListIteratorByCondition(DefaultOfBizDelegator.java:517)
	at com.atlassian.jira.ofbiz.WrappingOfBizDelegator.findListIteratorByCondition(WrappingOfBizDelegator.java:343)

	at com.sun.proxy.$Proxy158.findUserHistory(Unknown Source)  <+3>
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at org.springframework.aop.support.AopUtils.invokeJoinpointUsingReflection(AopUtils.java:307)
	at org.springframework.osgi.service.importer.support.internal.aop.ServiceInvoker.doInvoke(ServiceInvoker.java:58)
	at org.springframework.osgi.service.importer.support.internal.aop.ServiceInvoker.invoke(ServiceInvoker.java:62)

	at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)
Caused by: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDataSourceException: SQL Exception while executing the following:SELECT sq_.ID FROM (SELECT ID, ROW_NUMBER() OVER (ORDER BY UPDATED DESC) rnum FROM dbo.jiraissue WHERE PROJECT IN (?, ?,... ?) ) sq_ WHERE sq_.rnum <= 5 (Prepared or callable statement has more than 2000 parameter markers.)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.jdbc.SQLProcessor.prepareStatement(SQLProcessor.java:534)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDAO.selectListIteratorByCondition(GenericDAO.java:844)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericHelperDAO.findListIteratorByCondition(GenericHelperDAO.java:194)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDelegator.findListIteratorByCondition(GenericDelegator.java:1235)
	at com.atlassian.jira.ofbiz.DefaultOfBizDelegator.findListIteratorByCondition(DefaultOfBizDelegator.java:512)
{noformat}

h3. Notes
It seems that this can also use up connections in the DBCP and not release them back into the pool, subsequently multiple interactions with the database that experience this error can cause the DBCP to time out and JIRA will cease to function properly (as it cannot obtain connections from the DB). This is not currently verified, however has been anecdotally viewed on customer instances and was corrected by working around the SQL that was causing these errors. This was caused by issues with large history records (over 2k) and deleting some of the history records or restricting the access of the issue corrected the problem. 

{noformat}
2014-06-16 06:06:29,718 StreamsCompletionService::thread-1 ERROR admin 366x32x5 oardx6 10.60.2.93 /plugins/servlet/streams [atlassian.streams.internal.LocalActivityProvider] Exception building feed
com.atlassian.jira.exception.DataAccessException: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDataSourceException: Ofbiz generates queries with large IN clauses that result in while executing the following:SELECT sq_.ID FROM (SELECT ID, ROW_NUMBER() OVER (ORDER BY UPDATED DESC) rnum FROM dbo.jiraissue WHERE PROJECT IN (?, ?, ..?) ) sq_ WHERE sq_.rnum <= 5 (Prepared or callable statement has more than 2000 parameter markers.)
...
Caused by: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDataSourceException: SQL Exception while executing the following:SELECT sq_.ID FROM (SELECT ID, ROW_NUMBER() OVER (ORDER BY UPDATED DESC) rnum FROM dbo.jiraissue WHERE PROJECT IN (?, ?, ?,..., ?) ) sq_ WHERE sq_.rnum <= 5 (Prepared or callable statement has more than 2000 parameter markers.)
{noformat}


{panel:bgColor=#E7F4FA}
This is similar to [*JRA-19317*:Ofbiz generates queries with large IN clauses that result in ORA-01795 errors|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-19317], which affects Oracle. However, it is fixed in JIRA 6.1.1
{panel}
fields.summary: Ofbiz generates queries with large IN clauses that result in SQL Server errors
Investigate browse project issue in cluster performance tests: "tabHtml" undefined in soy template

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-38788].
  {panel}

Update/workaround: 
I can create the pie chart after changing to Statistic Type = Reporter, and this generates the data matching that for "Creator" in the filter results view.

I can add a "Filter Results" gadget to a dashboard for a saved query to find open bugs created this week.

However, when I try to add a pie chart that displays the results of this filter by creator, an internal server error results. Note that the same pie chart works when I select parameters other than Creator as the Statistic Type.

Screen shot attached, showing the failed pie chart on the left and the successful filter results on the right.

This is the query:
issuetype = Bug AND (createdDate >= -6d OR status in (open, reopened) AND resolved >= -6d) AND resolution = Unresolved ORDER BY creator
fields.summary: Dashboard gadget: Cannot add a pie chart of recent bugs by creator to a dashboard.
Background re-index does not take a (read) lock on the index and this allows a foreground re-index to start while the background re-index is still running.

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce
1. Modify the two property values for 'login.url' and 'link.login.url' in JIRA's seraph-config.xml. Eg. 
{noformat}
<param-name>login.url</param-name>            
            <param-value>/custom-login-path</param-value>
{noformat}
and
{noformat}
<param-name>link.login.url</param-name>
<param-value>/custom-login-path-link</param-value>
{noformat}

2. Load a direct link in JIRA's Issue Navigator without being authenticated, eg. {{http://localhost:8080/627/browse/SSP-24?jql=}}

3. Notice that none of the links to login are pointed at the right URL.
!login-url.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected results
- Login URL defined in seraph-config.xml being used

h3. Actual results
- Default login.url and link.login.url still being used when loading JIRA Issue Navigator

h3. Workaround
- Access a URL, outside the Issue Navigator, as that appears to be the only affected area. Eg. {{http://localhost:8080/627/secure/Dashboard.jspa}} should render the correct URL links
fields.summary: JIRA Issue Navigator does not respect login.url or link.login.url parameters defined in seraph-config.xml
The start sprint button is hard to find
JIRA Admin Helper needs to be more clear about context in the "Where's my field?" functionality.
Duplicate entries when jira is connected to stash and fisheye
